src:
Đoković se igrao sa Cicipasom
Danas 58 minuta na terenu u Bersiju, sutra za finale mastersa u Parizu protiv Grigora Dimitrova

01 Nov 2019

Novak Đoković je danas pokazao mlađanom Stefanosu Cicipasu gde mu je mesto, ko je stariji i bolji gotovo savršenom predstavom u četvrtfinalu mastersa u Parizu.
Naš as je odigrao u Bersiju majstorski, šampionski, a da nije napravio nekoliko sitnijih grešaka, rezultat bi bio još ubedljivi. Ovako, morao je da se "zadovolji" sa 6:1 i 6:2  za 58 minuta čime je izjednačio na 2-2 u međusobnim susretima sa Grkom, osvetivši mu se usput za nedavni preokret u Šangaju koji će ga u ponedeljak koštati gubitka prvog mesta od Rafe Nadala.
Od samog starta susret videlo se da je naš teniser posebno motivisan, dok se Atinjanin bukvalno kao grana povijao pod napadima Đokovića. Cicipas jednostavno nije imao sportski odgovor na zaista zastrašujuću izvedbu Beograđanina koji je imao tri vezane set lopte za 6:0. Uspeo je koliko-toliko Atinjanin da spase obraz, ali ne i meč.
Vrlo slično sa jakim intentezitetom i preciznim udarcima, vezujući osvojene poene odigrao je Đoković i u nastavku susreta. A kada je na trenutke delovalo da 21-godišnji protivnik ima šanse da "uhvati poslednji voz" usledila bi nova kanonada i dalje prvog rekete sveta.
Njegov naredni protivnik će biti Grigor Dimitrov koji je bez većih problema sa 6:2 i 7:5 očekivano bio bolji od Čileanca Kristijana Garina. Da podsetimo, Novak u ponedeljak gubi prvo mesta ma kako se završio ovaj turnir i preuzima ga Nadal koji bi, ako osvoji prvi put u karijeri titulu u Parizu osigurao lidersku poziciju na ATP listi do kraja godine.

(Foto: Reuters)
text:
Djokovic played with Cicipas
58 minutes on the pitch in Bersi today, tomorrow for the Paris Masters final against Grigor Dimitrov

01 Nov 2019

Novak Djokovic today showed the young Stefanos Cicipas where he is, who is older and better with a near perfect performance in the quarterfinals of the Paris Masters.
Our ace played in Bersi masterfully, championingly, without making a few minor mistakes, the result would be even more convincing. Thus, he had to "settle" with 6: 1 and 6: 2 in 58 minutes, equalizing to 2-2 in the match against the Greeks, avenging him on the way to the recent turn in Shanghai, which will cost him Monday's loss of the first places from Rafe Nadal.
From the very beginning, the match showed that our tennis player was especially motivated, while the Athenian was literally branching out under the attacks of Djokovic. Cicipas simply did not have the sporting response to the truly daunting performance of the Belgrade man, who had three tied sets of 6-0. He managed to save the Athenians as much as to save his cheek, but not the match.
Very similar with strong intentionality and precise punches, Djokovic also played in tying the points. And when it seemed for a moment that the 21-year-old opponent had a chance to "catch the last train", a new cannonade would continue to be the first racket in the world.
His next opponent will be Grigor Dimitrov who, without major problems with 6: 2 and 7: 5, was expected to be better than Chilean Christian Garin. To remind, Novak loses first places on Monday, however, as this tournament ends and is taken over by Nadal, who, if he wins his first career title in Paris, would secure a leadership position on the ATP list by the end of the year.

(Photo by Reuters)
